content:
19, 2014
												It's a 4 Player medival Beat-em-up set in a comedic medival setting, let's get this out of the way, it's a port from XBLA, meaning it WILL tell you the XBOX controlls, and it WILL tell you to use a controller.The game is fun, but since there are only 2 attack buttons it gets redundant fast. Much like with borderlands 2, the story is just too repetitive and they have too many characters to play it as. I guarantee you 1 playthrough of this should be enough to quench your thirst.I'm not saying it's a bad game, the thing about it is just that the only replay value it has is with it's 3000 extra characters, but think about that, would you want to sit at your computer for hours a day as each character trying to get them to level 99? of course not.The game is good though, and it does have some minigames, but expect to lose at them.i give it a 6.5/10.

content:
y 25
												Castle Crashers is a very fun single player or co-op experience similar to the good 'ol days Double Dragon and Streets of Rage beatem up style games but with its own unique story line and humor as well as a robust leveling system, weapon upgrades (tiered by lv) and pet boosts.  There is also tons of replayability here and there are secrets all over the map once you have unlocked certain things in the story so the fun is not even close to being done once you beat the story mode.  You can also unlock 20+ characters to play and level up as which also keeps it fun and fresh!The game has been around for quite a while and has had quite the support as well as new stuff added to it over the years.  I originally purchased this on my Xbox 360 when it came out and played it quite a bit.  I re-purchased it on Steam to complete my collection and have had just as much fun if not more fun as I did when it was brand new.If you like beatum up style games with a bit of leveling and weapon progression as well as a funny story, this game is for you.  I recommend it for sure!  Its even more fun with a group of three of your friends as you fight over sharing money while arguing over who should unlock the weapon or pet first and in which order everyone will get it!  Fun times indeed!

content:
, 2016
												This is one of the most awesome games I've ever played. The graphics are amazing with a unigue design and a great style. This game is really fun to play alone or with friends, and is filled with challenging bosses and enemies. It has loads of playable characters from the derpy villager to the Harcore necromancer, as well as tons of weapons with different buffs and debuffs. It's filled with content, and you can play the game over and over again without getting bored, or jump into insane mode. The level design is on point, and the soundtrack is done very well. There's even a pvp or boardgame option if you're that kind of person.The only things I don't like are the frankly immachure humor, and the part in some levels where you kiss the princess. Other than that, this is an amazing game that is definitely worth the $15. I'd rate 9.5/10.

content:
y 4, 2013
												An evil wizard steals a large, mystical gem from the king of an unnamed empire, as well as kidnapping its four princesses. The king sends the four brave knights that spearhead his guard into the vast land to rescue the princesses, recover the gem, and defeat the evil wizard. Unfortunately, the knights first have to contend with an army of barbarians storming the king's castle as the wizard makes his escape.Castle Crashers is a gem among the endless onslaught of casual games available on Steam. It has its flaws, of course, but when all the elements are considered, it makes for a fantastic, "I'm bored, let's play" sort of game that you could very well find yourself coming back to again and again.The game is a side-scrolling, linear beat-'em-up, with a silly plot, very apt character design, and great handling in terms of gameplay. When you begin, you take control of one of four knights, each with a unique elemental affiliation; the Green Knight wields deadly poison magic, the Orange Knight pyrokinetically commands fire magic, the Blue Knight freezes enemies with ice magic, and the Red Knight shocks his foes into submission with electric magic. As you progress, more characters are unlocked and thusly become playable, most of which are enemies you will face on your journey. However, replaying the game as a new character gets tiresome if done in excess. Regardless, the wide array of playable characters allows you to find one you like. I adore games that allow for this,The gameplay handles well, with a great capacity for combo attacks. Chaining melee attacks of varying strengths, ranged arrow attacks, and magic blasts aptly is the key to victory. Get surrounded, though, and constant attacks will quickly see you beaten down. Drink potions to restore health, or revive fallen comrades with first aid practices. Level up and enhance your knight in one of four fields: power, defense, agility, and magic. Find new weapons with varying properties that can either complement your knight's strengths or cover for his weaknesses. Animal orbs serve as companions and can provie passive benefits, so find as many as you can! The amount of additional goodies you can find is staggering, and it allows you to further set yourself apart amongst your group.The multiplayer mode makes this very enjoyable, and since the level-up mechanic is based on hits landed, a player playing through alone from the start would be on even grounds with a group of four playing through from the start for most of the game. Multiplayer also greatly increases your chances for survival, as potions are used automatically and players can revive fallen comrades. It's a lot more fun to play with a friend or two.The art style is adorable and hilarious, and it offers a lot of laughs. A forest filled with lovable critters that are inclined to soil themselves is not to be overlooked. There are a bunch of little things that make this game that much more charming, and that's partially why I love it so much.The game does have its flaws, though. Some of the bosses have frustrating attack methods that is countered by almost nothing. The Conehead Groom boss, for instance, can be either exploited into submission or result in you being swiftly beaten down without a chance to heal. This is also an Xbox 360 port, so the game even insists you use a controller. A keyboard is usable, but it's very awkward and sometimes more trouble than it's worth. The game can, for some, degenerate into "run forward, mash buttons, run forward again." In that case it simply may not cater to you.Those aside, I adore this game and it's always great to come back to, especially with friends.

content:
ber 26, 2014
												Castle Crashers is a indie game developed by The Behemoth and is a 2D beat em up videogame that has got a minimal amount of RPG mechanics. There is minimal story and it is no reason to buy the game as it is basically just evil wizard kidnaps 4 princesses and a gem and the king sends you to save the princess's and bring the gem back. On the way you fight Barbarian's, Thieves, Trolls, A faction of knights, fire demons, pirate-ninja's and the evil wizard's minions beyond other things. The game features characters which you choose to play. You have 4 characters unlocked by default and along the way you can unlock more by completing certain stages, finishing solo arena's or finishing the game with certain characters. Many of the enemies you fight along the way can be unlocked to play as although this does not affect the enemies at all. Each character has the ability to use a melee weapon, a bow and magic. While many characters bows are just changed cosmetically and weaponry can be found and equipped instead of being character bound barring a certain character they all have magic that is unique to only a couple or even just one character. As a example the Orange knight's magic is a fire type while the Red Knight uses lightning and unlockable characters can have magic ranging from random weapons, to sawblades or nature magic. The game features a levelling in which each character is levelled seperately with a maximum level of 99. Upon levelling up each character can assign a stat point to one of the following:Strength: which increases damage dealt by the characters melee weapons.Agility: which affects the damage and speed of the bow along with the speed of the character themself.Defense: which affects the health of the character as well as his resistance to enemy attacks. Magic: which increases the damage dealt by the characters magic attacks as well as unlocking new magic moves to use.It is entirely possible to max a characters stats at around level 78 leaving 11 more levels. One thing to note is that you do NOT gain exp on kills but instead you gain exp each time you hit a enemy. You cannot juggle a dead enemy in the air for exp and neither does damage affect how much exp you get from a hit.Combat is simple in Castle Crushers with 2 melee attacks, one bow attack and up to about 3-4 different magic attacks. The game is also able to have more strategy ablied to it like the timing of juggling a enemy to keep them off the ground and unable to hit you. Standard enemies in Castle Crashers usually consist of enemies that have the same kind of moves as your knights which can include magic and bows depending on the enemy type. Most standard enemies can be juggled with enough practice which is a efficient way to deal with them. Along the way towards the evil wizard you will encounter buffed up or 'Beefy' versions of enemies who no longer consist of the move sets of you during your standard form. These enemies have got more hp than there standard versions and can be impossible to juggle sometimes. They have multiple attacks that include grabbing you and either throwing you at another player in co-op or just throwing you away during singleplayer. Then you encounter boss's which are usually signified by a HP Bar in the top center of the screen. These enemies are tough and mostly have unique attacks that are un usable by other enemies and yourself. They can also vary in there appearance with a cyclops or a giant barbarian.The items of Castle Crashers come in the forms of Bombs, Potions, Sandwichs and animal orbs. Potions are your standard fantasy potion which when used they refill your health fully. Bombs are placed on the spot you are and have a fuse. Upon detonating they will damage anything within their radius including you. Sandwichs are a special consumable which when eaten turns you into a 'Beefy' version of your character. During this state you have different attacks and can also remove obstacles that can only be removed by being in a 'beefy' form. Animal orbs are a kind of creature or animal that will follow you around and while equipped will grant you a buff ranging from stat increases, to finding food for you or even increasing the amount of exp that you earn. A animal orb stays with you until you take another animal orb with you. Upon doing that you will be able to find the animal orb in a building next to the blacksmith's frog. Animal orbs have to be unlocked by finding and equipping them.This game is mainly a co-op title with optional pvp in the arena and not so optional pvp whenever you save a princess. However the game is completely playable and finishable solo and i would still recommend it even if you have no friends that are interested or own the game. One notice of warning however is that during co-op if one person is lagging it can either cause the entire game to pause with a waiting for players notice or it can desync players which can cause players to be up to different parts of the mission and see each other doing different things. As an eample during one level me and 2 friends were fighting mobs when i started to get laggy. It seemed to pass but we got desycned which meant that while on my screen they were running around and hitting mid air while i was fighting mobs they were actually fighting the boss that was past the mobs and i was the one not contributing. A quick fix would be to just exit and re-enter the game and maybe restart the lobby.Castle Crashers has 3 gamemodes: Campaign which can be played Solo or Co-op, All you can quaff which is a gamemode where you and 3 other players/AI have to mash certain keys to quickly eat the food and whoever eats all their portion of the food first wins and finally the arena which has got multiple gamemodes in it which include standard pvp with up to 4 players and a mode where you vs each other in trying to amass the most amount of gold by digging up treasure, during this you cannot use melee, bows or magic alothough you can whack the other player by digging with the shovel underneath them. There are two other gamemodes in arena however i have not played as much arena and as such cannot remember them.This game has got a moderate amount of replayability when you first finish it if you want to unlock all the animal orbs and can have even more if you plan on unlocking all characters. However to get to level 99 is repetitive as you would have most likely finished all the area's multiple times and have gotten sick of it.Finally i would say that i definitely recommend this game if your a fan of 2d beat em up with a tiny bit of rpg meshed in and that although they recommend using a Xbox 360 controller to play i find it perfectly fine using a keyboard for it although the button prompts only being in Xbox 360 controller layout is a bit of a paint although it can be overcome.

content:
2016
												Warning: This is an old review that has been re-uploaded intentionally to not only fix some false/missing information, but also to remove the ratings this review has received due to the false/missing information. This has been your warning.Castle Crashers is a game where you take the role of one of four knights who have to save the 4 princesses of the land and the king's magical crystal (no idea why it's so special), while fighting the evil wizard's minions, hostile inhabitants, and even the environment at times. It's gameplay is a Beat-Em-Up with RPG elements. Every time you injure an enemy, you gain EXP, after gaining enough you level up (much like any RPG). Every level up grants you a curtain amount of skill points. These can be spent on your attack, magic, running speed (and even arrow shot length as a bonus), and defense. After gaining curtain amount of levels, your character learns a new technique such as the spin-attack or maybe a strong finisher. If you invest enough points onto the magic skill "tree", you can learn new magic techniques such as your character's specific magic projectile such as fire or electricity. It is worth nothing that magic attacks differ from all characters. Nobody is a reskin of another in terms of magic.As you progress through the game, there will be lots of things to find & collect. For example: there are many different weapons with different stats and elements, the golden treasures (you require them to continue the story), animal orbs (little cute (or ugly) animal/monster buddies that increase specific stats further, or provide buffs such as being able to pick up items from far away or possibly having health regeneration), and of course money.There is quite a lot to come back to the game for: many secret items hidden within levels requiring specific conditions to be fulfilled, multiplayer, mini-games with multiplayer features as well, DLC adding even more content into the game such as characters and/or weapons, and a hardcore mode after beating the game with even more weapons & animal orbs that were not in the original game. Did I forget about unlockable/secret characters?The music is very well-done, even to today's standards for a classic game. It always seems to keep that "Epic" feel throughout the adventure. I must also give credit that the tracks never feel offbeat, especially during boss fights. Sure, some tracks are re-used, but there is enough variety that it doesn't even matter. While the music doesn't sound very medieval, it still stands as a major selling-point for me in terms of buying the game.Enemies in this game aren't that easy to kill, but they aren't hard either. Like other Beat-Em-Ups, enemies in this game head towards you and try to damage you. When you attack them, you can knock them down and they will get back up, unless you kill them. You'll know if their corpse flashes a bit then disappears. The bosses are quite different in terms of taking them down. Like any generic boss, they have a Life Meter (this time displayed at the bottom of the screen). Once it's depleted to zero, you win. What makes bosses special in this game however is actually the character and humor they bring into the chaos that the game already was. The barbarian boss always gave me a good laugh, and I am sure you would too after being used to the head-slicing and many things being killed.The humor in this game. Just the humor. It's just insanely clever, and devious at the same time. The barbarian boss being a good example. The fight itself can be quite humorous. There is tons of humor in the game, mostly violent yet guilty-pleasure kind of humor. Whether it be a pooping owl, a cyclops wedding crash, or even the silliness of the hostile inhabitants.Who's ready for some fun facts?Fun Fact: Did you know before the "Barbarian Makeover" update (also is known as version 2.0), there was an old mini-game (that is now exclusive to the Xbox 360 versions of the game) called "All You Can Quaff"? This mini-game involved you mashing the buttons as fast as you can to beat your rivals in an eating contest. The achievement related to the mini-game was changed to the "Back off Barbarian" mini-game achievement. Those who already obtained that achievement previously would still have it.Fun Fact #2: If you own Battleblock Theater along with Castle Crashers, these games actually sync with each other! In Castle Crashers, you can play as Hatty Hattington and unleash the wonders of green gems (and some other fun Battleblock Theater related stuff) at your enemies along with having the golden whale animal orb, which is basically a mini-money generator. In Battleblock Theater on the other hand, you get a Castle Crasher head. Worth quite a lot on the market due to it's rarity and being a promotional item. You don't have to buy the "Can't Stop Laughing" bundle to get the promo items, you can buy them separately and still obtain the promo, although it'll likely cost more $ from you.Overall, I feel that Castle Crashers is a blast to play (despite me buying it three times on different platforms), and is worth the 15$ price tag, even more worth it buying the "Can't Stop Laughing" bundle. I also must exaggerate bring your friends as this is an awesome game to play with friends, whether it be online or offline. I will most curtainly recommend this to anyone looking for a fun time with their friends (or by themselves..like myself..#ForeverAlone).

content:
ber 16, 2014
												Extremely funny game, specially with multiple players to share the laughter of... pretty much everything!Everything in this game is meant to cause some chuckles, from the animations, sounds, bosses and even the storyline.The gameplay is a bit retro, 2D mash-to-win (similar to Streets of Rage), but with plenty of weapons and adorable petsto collect (Gotta Catch'em All, anyone?). There are also some basic RPG elements, like stats and level-ups, andsometimes some grinding is advised before moving to certain areas, but nothing unreasonable.The game has a lot of levels and variety, but they're pretty short and once the game is finished, there's little to doexcept the aforementioned collecting. The online modes are pretty weak, just stick to 'coop' the main game.Recommended to those looking for simple gameplay and story, and want little depth but a lot of fun in their game!

content:
ber 26, 2014
												Castle Crashers is a indie game developed by The Behemoth and is a 2D beat em up videogame that has got a minimal amount of RPG mechanics. There is minimal story and it is no reason to buy the game as it is basically just evil wizard kidnaps 4 princesses and a gem and the king sends you to save the princess's and bring the gem back. On the way you fight Barbarian's, Thieves, Trolls, A faction of knights, fire demons, pirate-ninja's and the evil wizard's minions beyond other things. The game features characters which you choose to play. You have 4 characters unlocked by default and along the way you can unlock more by completing certain stages, finishing solo arena's or finishing the game with certain characters. Many of the enemies you fight along the way can be unlocked to play as although this does not affect the enemies at all. Each character has the ability to use a melee weapon, a bow and magic. While many characters bows are just changed cosmetically and weaponry can be found and equipped instead of being character bound barring a certain character they all have magic that is unique to only a couple or even just one character. As a example the Orange knight's magic is a fire type while the Red Knight uses lightning and unlockable characters can have magic ranging from random weapons, to sawblades or nature magic. The game features a levelling in which each character is levelled seperately with a maximum level of 99. Upon levelling up each character can assign a stat point to one of the following:Strength: which increases damage dealt by the characters melee weapons.Agility: which affects the damage and speed of the bow along with the speed of the character themself.Defense: which affects the health of the character as well as his resistance to enemy attacks. Magic: which increases the damage dealt by the characters magic attacks as well as unlocking new magic moves to use.It is entirely possible to max a characters stats at around level 78 leaving 11 more levels. One thing to note is that you do NOT gain exp on kills but instead you gain exp each time you hit a enemy. You cannot juggle a dead enemy in the air for exp and neither does damage affect how much exp you get from a hit.Combat is simple in Castle Crushers with 2 melee attacks, one bow attack and up to about 3-4 different magic attacks. The game is also able to have more strategy ablied to it like the timing of juggling a enemy to keep them off the ground and unable to hit you. Standard enemies in Castle Crashers usually consist of enemies that have the same kind of moves as your knights which can include magic and bows depending on the enemy type. Most standard enemies can be juggled with enough practice which is a efficient way to deal with them. Along the way towards the evil wizard you will encounter buffed up or 'Beefy' versions of enemies who no longer consist of the move sets of you during your standard form. These enemies have got more hp than there standard versions and can be impossible to juggle sometimes. They have multiple attacks that include grabbing you and either throwing you at another player in co-op or just throwing you away during singleplayer. Then you encounter boss's which are usually signified by a HP Bar in the top center of the screen. These enemies are tough and mostly have unique attacks that are un usable by other enemies and yourself. They can also vary in there appearance with a cyclops or a giant barbarian.The items of Castle Crashers come in the forms of Bombs, Potions, Sandwichs and animal orbs. Potions are your standard fantasy potion which when used they refill your health fully. Bombs are placed on the spot you are and have a fuse. Upon detonating they will damage anything within their radius including you. Sandwichs are a special consumable which when eaten turns you into a 'Beefy' version of your character. During this state you have different attacks and can also remove obstacles that can only be removed by being in a 'beefy' form. Animal orbs are a kind of creature or animal that will follow you around and while equipped will grant you a buff ranging from stat increases, to finding food for you or even increasing the amount of exp that you earn. A animal orb stays with you until you take another animal orb with you. Upon doing that you will be able to find the animal orb in a building next to the blacksmith's frog. Animal orbs have to be unlocked by finding and equipping them.This game is mainly a co-op title with optional pvp in the arena and not so optional pvp whenever you save a princess. However the game is completely playable and finishable solo and i would still recommend it even if you have no friends that are interested or own the game. One notice of warning however is that during co-op if one person is lagging it can either cause the entire game to pause with a waiting for players notice or it can desync players which can cause players to be up to different parts of the mission and see each other doing different things. As an eample during one level me and 2 friends were fighting mobs when i started to get laggy. It seemed to pass but we got desycned which meant that while on my screen they were running around and hitting mid air while i was fighting mobs they were actually fighting the boss that was past the mobs and i was the one not contributing. A quick fix would be to just exit and re-enter the game and maybe restart the lobby.Castle Crashers has 3 gamemodes: Campaign which can be played Solo or Co-op, All you can quaff which is a gamemode where you and 3 other players/AI have to mash certain keys to quickly eat the food and whoever eats all their portion of the food first wins and finally the arena which has got multiple gamemodes in it which include standard pvp with up to 4 players and a mode where you vs each other in trying to amass the most amount of gold by digging up treasure, during this you cannot use melee, bows or magic alothough you can whack the other player by digging with the shovel underneath them. There are two other gamemodes in arena however i have not played as much arena and as such cannot remember them.This game has got a moderate amount of replayability when you first finish it if you want to unlock all the animal orbs and can have even more if you plan on unlocking all characters. However to get to level 99 is repetitive as you would have most likely finished all the area's multiple times and have gotten sick of it.Finally i would say that i definitely recommend this game if your a fan of 2d beat em up with a tiny bit of rpg meshed in and that although they recommend using a Xbox 360 controller to play i find it perfectly fine using a keyboard for it although the button prompts only being in Xbox 360 controller layout is a bit of a paint although it can be overcome.

content:
2015
												This is a nice, fluid, beat-em-up game that is surprisingly addictive. First of all, this game focuses on combat. It only makes sense that this is what the game exceeds at. It offers classic melee combos intertwined with magical onslaughts and slick bow-shooting. As a result, the combat is never boring and keeps you eager to bash skulls all around. The other aspects of the game are pretty decent. The gameplay never lags, the story is shallow yet fun, and the cartoon-like graphics provide scenery that isn't detailed enough to distract you from the gameplay.All in all, I'd recommend it to the casual gamer who wants a little reprieve from the more strategical high-end games available.

content:
6, 2014
												This game is simply AMAZING.You pick a character of your liking, finish the game with him and unlock new characters + Insane mode for the character you finished the game with. You got bored repeating the story mode with your usual weapon and animal orbs? Simple, go on a quest to get them all! The Animal Orbs are helpful (and some have secret effects) which will make your playthroughs with new characters far more easier and fun!Considering weapons, there are alot to choose from. Some are hidden, some are picked up from monsters and some are just given after boss fights. There is a variety of weaponary to choose from. Also, you can get a bow and a boomerang (which is hidden and a special pet is required to get it) to boost up your combos and kill everyone with style.The story of the game is quite fun and interesting. Though I warn you the game is not that long, (about 2 hours max) but you have to keep in mind that you will be repeating it for a great amount of time if you want to unlock new characters. (Some are given when you beat arenas SOLO)My final opinion:This game is WORTH BUYING. On sale it's usually 50% or 75% off which makes it more worth the money. If you like fighting, unlocking new play methods and rewards, THIS IS THE GAME FOR YOU!

content:
6, 2015
												Castle Crashers is one of the best co-op games that i have played yet. This game is a button mashser so take note if you son't like that type of games. I really like the graphic style that looks like a cartoon. You start out with 4 different characters that look almost the same but are yet so different. They each have some type of magic that you can use. The blue one uses ice, the yelow one uses fire, the green one uses poision/poison gas and the red one (the one that i use) uses lightning. You can level each one of these characters up individually and everytime you level up you get some skill points that you can speend on stenght, magic power, health/defence and agility. The strenght upgrade let's you dish out more damage, the magic power will make your magic more powerfull and give you new magic tricks, the helth/defence one gives you more health and defence (duh..) and the agility one makes you faster and do more damage with your bow. The bow is one of the items that you can get others include a boomerang, a shovel, a health poition (up to 5), a super sandwich (up to five, a bomb (up to 5) and some quest items. On your quest to save the kingdom from an evil wizard you can have a flying pet following you. These pets will give you a variety of boosts like helping you level up faster, hit some of the enemies, helping you find new weapons and others. There are so many different weapons that can boost your stats or make some stats go down while the weapon is equipped like for example a weapon might give you +2 in strenght but -1 in magic. I won't spoil anything but when you beat the game the character you beat it with will unlock a new character so if you are more than on person the person who played played blue might get an alien and the person who played red might get a skeleton (i don't know what the different charaters get). I can't really mention the soundtrack and the soundeffects since i didn't have the sound on most of the time but what i heard was pretty good. When you have beaten the game and have a high level charater you will be pleased to find out that you unlocked INSANE MODE which i am curretly playing with my friend. INSANE MODE is the entire game again but much harder. Before you start insane mode you can buy some weapons and pets at a high cost but they help a lot. I forgot to mention the money. In stages you will collect money that enemies drop and these money can be spent on potions, pets, swords and other good stuff. One of the good aspects of this money system is that you don't EVER have to spend any of it. You can collect pets and swords everywhere so you don't have to buy anything. Shops are located al around the map and there is almost always a boss battle close to them. These boss battles are so good. They are really creative and can prove to be quite a challenge sometimes but not to hard. I mean like you had to fight a corncob that when you hit it turn into popcorn that give you health. There is a lot to do in this game and it is really gret but now to the parts that i didn't like so much. The game starts by saying the it is best to play with a controller and sure thats is fine but the game does not show any pc controls ANYWHERE! The controls for pc kind of suck too. Sometimes the achivemets can be such a pain to get and you need a friend to help you get them. On the topics of needing people to play with this game is nowhere nears as fun playing alone as it is playing with someone else. I tried alone for a while and it was not very fun at all so if you don't have anyone to play with then DON'T buy this game, but if you have someone to play with i defintly think that you should buy this game. To be honest this is an amazing game when playing with you friends. The game is so creative and fun and there are so many sword and pets and charaters because you can get more charaters from arenas and  beating the game with new charaters gives you more characters. The graphics are really cool and the gameplay is also really fun. The controls can be a bit stupid at times but it can be overlooked if you have gotten used to them. If you can play with someone else this game is a 9/10 because it is so fun and creative and all the stuff you can do even after beating the game it has high replay value. If you have someone to play with BUY THIS GAME! However if you don't have anyoe to play with the game becomes so much less fun. Alone it is one long grind (if you want to complete it) or just a game you will only beat once and then thats it. Alone i would give it a 6/10 because it is still a great game in my opinion but i would say DON'T BUY THIS GAME IF YOU ARE ALONE! I hope this review was useful. It was my first so i would love critisism. Thank you:-)

content:
, 2015
												An old-school beat'em up, where you have to save princesses, by first freeing them and then getting a kiss from them. 10/10 for originality.Graphics - If you have watched any of the 90's - early 20's cartoons, you are going to fall inlove with the graphic style of this game. As a person who grew up watching cartoons, everything I see has a mixed combination of new and nostalgia.10/10Music - Boy does the music in this game have a wide variety of emotions, from the melodical and calm one that is playing while you are just moving on to the powering up it does the moment you enter a fight. Overall the place and time for every single song is perfect. 10/10Cinematics - It does have quite a few cinematics, most of them are to introduce a level or a boss, but still you won't see a one that copies the other, every single one is unique. I have to add most of them are quite funny, 10/10Story - A pretty basic story, go there, save that, get a kiss, easy as that. The but the comedical depth it adds is just tremendous. the story is mostly told through text bubbles, either way your going to see the funny side in the text or through their action. 10/10Content -  The game lacks nothing, enough enemy variations to keep yourself interested, a wide variety of weather types, random things that happen on the screen. No matter how much you play, you wont be able to predict what a person will say or do. 10/10Controls - You can play on either mouse+keyboard or controler (I recommend the controler). Both of them are fluid and responsive. 10/10Gameplay - A really fun experience, but best played with friends, even by playing alone you are punishing yourself, by what you are missing if you have 4 players and that it is really hard for 1 player. That is either the game really does get way too hard for 1 player or that I am a bad player (the second). 10/10Just the perfect game in my opinion, it gets every single thing it strives to get right, from the littlest detail to the biggest of ones. I strongly recommend playing with friends, either buy it for them (that won't happen),  make them buy it themselves (still won't happen) or buy it for your pet bear (most probable). I would like to add why the hell do you have a bear pet, but hey that is life.Overall score: 10/10

content:
y 4, 2013
												An evil wizard steals a large, mystical gem from the king of an unnamed empire, as well as kidnapping its four princesses. The king sends the four brave knights that spearhead his guard into the vast land to rescue the princesses, recover the gem, and defeat the evil wizard. Unfortunately, the knights first have to contend with an army of barbarians storming the king's castle as the wizard makes his escape.Castle Crashers is a gem among the endless onslaught of casual games available on Steam. It has its flaws, of course, but when all the elements are considered, it makes for a fantastic, "I'm bored, let's play" sort of game that you could very well find yourself coming back to again and again.The game is a side-scrolling, linear beat-'em-up, with a silly plot, very apt character design, and great handling in terms of gameplay. When you begin, you take control of one of four knights, each with a unique elemental affiliation; the Green Knight wields deadly poison magic, the Orange Knight pyrokinetically commands fire magic, the Blue Knight freezes enemies with ice magic, and the Red Knight shocks his foes into submission with electric magic. As you progress, more characters are unlocked and thusly become playable, most of which are enemies you will face on your journey. However, replaying the game as a new character gets tiresome if done in excess. Regardless, the wide array of playable characters allows you to find one you like. I adore games that allow for this,The gameplay handles well, with a great capacity for combo attacks. Chaining melee attacks of varying strengths, ranged arrow attacks, and magic blasts aptly is the key to victory. Get surrounded, though, and constant attacks will quickly see you beaten down. Drink potions to restore health, or revive fallen comrades with first aid practices. Level up and enhance your knight in one of four fields: power, defense, agility, and magic. Find new weapons with varying properties that can either complement your knight's strengths or cover for his weaknesses. Animal orbs serve as companions and can provie passive benefits, so find as many as you can! The amount of additional goodies you can find is staggering, and it allows you to further set yourself apart amongst your group.The multiplayer mode makes this very enjoyable, and since the level-up mechanic is based on hits landed, a player playing through alone from the start would be on even grounds with a group of four playing through from the start for most of the game. Multiplayer also greatly increases your chances for survival, as potions are used automatically and players can revive fallen comrades. It's a lot more fun to play with a friend or two.The art style is adorable and hilarious, and it offers a lot of laughs. A forest filled with lovable critters that are inclined to soil themselves is not to be overlooked. There are a bunch of little things that make this game that much more charming, and that's partially why I love it so much.The game does have its flaws, though. Some of the bosses have frustrating attack methods that is countered by almost nothing. The Conehead Groom boss, for instance, can be either exploited into submission or result in you being swiftly beaten down without a chance to heal. This is also an Xbox 360 port, so the game even insists you use a controller. A keyboard is usable, but it's very awkward and sometimes more trouble than it's worth. The game can, for some, degenerate into "run forward, mash buttons, run forward again." In that case it simply may not cater to you.Those aside, I adore this game and it's always great to come back to, especially with friends.

content:
14, 2016
												Decent, but overrated.  The combat and customization is great, and the multiplayer and trademark Newgrounds goofiness makes this a great party game. However, the experience/leveling is too overbearing; it controls not only the player's moveset and abilities, but also their health and damage-dealing ability. This kind of soils the experience by creating situations where the enemies either feel too tanky or too glassy, with rarely any middle ground if you play the game's levels out of order (or, if you play the game's tedious Hard Mode). And while the player character has diverse combat abilities, the enemies you fight start to become a little same-ish after a while.As far as single player gameplay goes, I honestly would prefer to play Turtles in Time for the SNES.  Price tag is "eh", your milage may vary.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
21, 2015
												Castle Crashers starts with a mysterious man snatching a large (and what I assume is also expensive) crystal and four lovely princesses from the King's throne. As one of the knights of the castle, it is your duty to retrieve the stolen goods and fair maidens. There's no dialogue, so you won't get more of a story than that unless you use your imagination. That's not a bad thing, though, especially for a brawler. If you're like me, you probably don't need an excuse to chop enemies up into little pieces.       The best part of Castle Crashers is exploring the world -- there are tons of levels that look and play completely differently. From slip-n-slide icy terrains to sandy deserts, it's clear that every area was crafted with care by the Behemoth's resident artist, Dan Paladin. His unique art style really brings the environments to life, and even the most ferocious monsters are still pretty cute. To counteract the adorableness of Paladin's creations, the game includes lots of potty humor and gore-filled battles.       The four starting knights wield magic powers that are differentiated by armor color -- Red has lightning, Green has poison, Orange has fire, and Blue has ice. Armed with magic and steel (or maybe a stick), you'll hack your way through mounds of enemies, gain experience points, and level up. As you progress, you'll garner more skill points to divide amongst four traits: Strength, Magic, Defense, and Agility. You can build up your character however you'd like, but that's not the only way you can customize.       On your quest to save the princesses you'll discover two other tools to help you: melee weaponry and animal orbs. You can find new weapons several ways; some will be obviously given to you and others you'll need to dig up or purchase at a store. Every weapon will affect your stats either positively or negatively. A regular sword might take away a point of Strength but add a point to your Agility, so you'll need to make the call on what traits are more important to you. The urge to find a better, cooler weapon never dies, so you can expect to search the many hidden crevices of the game until you find something that suites your style.       Animal orbs are probably my favorite thing in Castle Crashers because they're just so damn cute. There are 28 creatures (the two DLC animals from the Xbox 360 version are now included) scattered across the lands, and it's up to you to find them. Each animal provides a different boost and comes complete with an endearing name, so Meowburt the kitty increases your agility skill while Owlet the owl can retrieve food items for you. It's fun to battle with a small animal hovering around you, especially if it's Rammy the ram who will ram nearby enemies for you.       The Behemoth is known for making difficult games, most notably Alien Hominid, and that reputation stands true if you try and take on the campaign by yourself. Though it can be done, single-player assaults are more frustrating and less enjoyable than teaming up with other people. The biggest issue in trying to take on levels solo is that multiple enemies can assault you with ranged attacks, making it difficult to even stand up before being knocked down again. Since it's designed to be a cooperative game, it's hard to scold The Behemoth for making it incredibly difficult to conquer on your own. There's no "I" in team, after all.      Speaking of friends, you can crash castles with the favorite people on your friends list either locally or online. With local co-op mode, you can't sign into multiple accounts like you could in the Xbox 360 version; you can only split up the main PSN ID into quarters. Friends curious about the game can also drop-in and out from the map, but not in the middle of a level, so it's not truly drop-in, drop-out co-op. Despite that flaw, it is nice that you can mix up the local and online co-op modes, so if you and a buddy at your house want to pair up with some other people on your friends list, you can do that.      If you're lucky enough, you can successfully create private matches with your friends, but out of several people only one of my friends was able to host a match without getting an error. Dropping into quick matches, however, seemed to work just fine. While playing online, there was some noticeable lag, but it didn't actually interfere until the worst possible moment -- once I made it to last part of the final boss, the game I was in suddenly dropped. Curse you, wretched servers!!! I can only hope that a patch fixing these issues will become available for the PS3 faster than it did for the Xbox 360 version.      Since the game had to be re-coded for the PS3 anyway, The Behemoth added in some minor differences throughout the campaign along with some major re-hauls. The most noticeable change is that the former mode All You Can Quaff has been removed and replaced with Volleyball. True to real life volleyball, there are two four-person teams playing against each other. The only problem is it's really difficult to figure out if you're on the same plane as the ball, so expect to get scored on a lot until you get the hang of it.      Team Arena has also been updated to include teams. Now you can pair up for some two-on-two battles, or prove yourself against three other people. There's also an Insane Store that's unlocked once you've beaten the game on normal difficulty. All former DLC offerings and the popular Alien Hominid character are included, some are found in the Insane Store, while others have to be earned in different ways.      THE VERDICTThe Behemoth's incredibly fun cooperative beat 'em-up would have been pure brawler perfection if the multiplayer had launched in better form. It's incredibly frustrating that it's easier to play Castle Crashers with strangers than with your friends, but it's still a great brawler that will soak up your time. Between unlocking new characters so you can level them up to finding all of the hidden weapons and animal orbs, there's a lot to do in the campaign mode. If you never experienced the Xbox 360 version, or you happen to have more friends on your PSN list, Castle Crashers is a great game though you might want to wait for a multiplayer patch before investing.

content:
, 2015
												An old-school beat'em up, where you have to save princesses, by first freeing them and then getting a kiss from them. 10/10 for originality.Graphics - If you have watched any of the 90's - early 20's cartoons, you are going to fall inlove with the graphic style of this game. As a person who grew up watching cartoons, everything I see has a mixed combination of new and nostalgia.10/10Music - Boy does the music in this game have a wide variety of emotions, from the melodical and calm one that is playing while you are just moving on to the powering up it does the moment you enter a fight. Overall the place and time for every single song is perfect. 10/10Cinematics - It does have quite a few cinematics, most of them are to introduce a level or a boss, but still you won't see a one that copies the other, every single one is unique. I have to add most of them are quite funny, 10/10Story - A pretty basic story, go there, save that, get a kiss, easy as that. The but the comedical depth it adds is just tremendous. the story is mostly told through text bubbles, either way your going to see the funny side in the text or through their action. 10/10Content -  The game lacks nothing, enough enemy variations to keep yourself interested, a wide variety of weather types, random things that happen on the screen. No matter how much you play, you wont be able to predict what a person will say or do. 10/10Controls - You can play on either mouse+keyboard or controler (I recommend the controler). Both of them are fluid and responsive. 10/10Gameplay - A really fun experience, but best played with friends, even by playing alone you are punishing yourself, by what you are missing if you have 4 players and that it is really hard for 1 player. That is either the game really does get way too hard for 1 player or that I am a bad player (the second). 10/10Just the perfect game in my opinion, it gets every single thing it strives to get right, from the littlest detail to the biggest of ones. I strongly recommend playing with friends, either buy it for them (that won't happen),  make them buy it themselves (still won't happen) or buy it for your pet bear (most probable). I would like to add why the hell do you have a bear pet, but hey that is life.Overall score: 10/10

content:
6, 2015
												Castle Crashers is not a new game to me, In fact I pretty much played it non stop when it was released on the Xbox 360. But I’ve finally got round to playing it on the PC and my love affair has started allover again. Behemoth have a history of shall we say quirky but brilliant games, Alien Hominid and BattleBlock theater are the best known of them. Castle Crashers is no exception to this ether, the age old tail ofKnight rescues Princess is turned into the most ludicrous romp you’ve ever seen. You’ll find yourself retrieving weapons from the mouth of a giant toad, battling a Giant Cat Fish that is more cat than fish and even kissinga clown! Castle Crashers is anything but normal in any sense of the word and that’s its charm. The game its self is a fast paced side scrolling beat em up, much like Streets of Rage and Final Fight but completely different at the same time.  It has RPG elements too with characters being awardedpoints for each level they increase that they can spend on various skills such a magic and speed. Weapons can also be discovered through out the game, but with the exception of a few later ones offer very little advantageexcept cosmetics. The starting line up of four characters can be increased as you progress through various means. Pretty much every character in the game if a similar size to the starting line up will become playable. The story is set in medieval times, with your Knight sent off to rescue four Princess’s from an evil Sorcerer who has stolen the Kings prized emerald. As I’ve said, its not exactly original, its theway its told that’s original. Don’t misunderstand, its not Shakespeare but its extremely funny all the same. You will find yourself travelling through enemy encampments, lava worlds, deserts and even travelling on pirateships and alien spacecraft. Castle Crashers isn’t afraid to be obscure or bizarre and we love it for that. The boss battles are imaginative and just as off the wall as the rest of the game. The first boss sets the tone forthis very well, You enter an arena to be greeted by a giant barbarian only for him to be squashed by an even bigger one! Or there’s the Giant Metal Hand, the Cat Fish, Medusa and the list goes on. Don’t get me wrong, its not going to change the way we game or rewrite the genre. Castle Crashers is the ultimate pick up and play game, you don’t need to have played it before and you don’t needexperience with scrolling beat em ups. You just play it, there’s no better way to explain it, you just do it. I could explain to you how holding this button and pressing this makes your character do that. But it would bepointless, the system just works and works well. Its worth pointing out though that although most characters magic ability’s are the same with different effects. Some characters powers really are different and can changethe way you play. The graphics may not be cutting edge or super realistic, but all the same you’d be hard pressed to find a more stylised example of 2D draw sprites. There fun, colourful and unique, if you’ve playedany of Behemoth’s other offerings you know what to expect.See this and more reviews here http://cyberusuk.com/2015/03/03/castle-crashers-by-behemoth-review-be-a-knight/

content:
7, 2015
												Castle Crashers is one of the simplest games but it's so much fun.You attack by constantly mashing buttons which is encouraged rather than looked down upon. There are also combos you level up to learn that you can master and even though they do help greatly, even the best of players usually resort to mashing. Vertical alignment can usually be pretty annoying given the perspective, but a quick magic jump or bomb and you're good.Mashing is usually the worst possible tactic in Back Off Barbarian though.Straight outta Tom Fulp, Castle Crashers has all the Newgrounds humor you could ever want and more. This game shines in multiplayer, where you gang up on literally everything and go to town with your buds (or just play volleyball with some sand dudes.)

There are also combos you level up to learn that you can master and even though they do help greatly, even the best of players usually resort to mashing. Vertical alignment can usually be pretty annoying given the perspective, but a quick magic jump or bomb and you're good.Mashing is usually the worst possible tactic in Back Off Barbarian though.Straight outta Tom Fulp, Castle Crashers has all the Newgrounds humor you could ever want and more. This game shines in multiplayer, where you gang up on literally everything and go to town with your buds (or just play volleyball with some sand dudes.)

content:
er 2, 2015
												Please play this game with a controller please.Castle Crashers is an honestly silly game involving you, maybe three other friends, and sharp objects with which to stab other things with. Each colored knight has this ability which corralates to its color; in a sort of elemental attack or so.Its a fun and zany stab-em-up game with a penchant for mob-based mechanics which in my opinion, is the best and most fun way to do it. The best feeling is when you throw a dude into a bunch of other dudes.The art style is cute, but its unknown to me if its trying to be funny. I laughed anyway.My only real complaint is its rather easy to ram bosses into a corner and keep right on hitting them, and they can't do a darn thing as they're much too busy recoiling from my hits. Bosses are easy to cheese, is what I'm saying.Play it with friends if you can. I got four USB hookups. Let's do this. The green one is my favorite because poison.9/10

y 1, 2013
												The art style is quirky and fun and in a way, beautiful. I like it. The humor of The Behemoth is also something to enjoy, like the pooping owl and the small boss that gets replaced by a bigger boss--not to mention the hilarious unveiling of a certain princess. It took 13 hours for me to complete the game, which is on the longer side. It usually only takes 5 hours (according to what I've seen posted) to complete the game. CC has tons of replayability with so many characters and insane mode, but I'm just not one for doing the same levels over again. All in all, I'd give it 8/10, and say it's worth playing at least once.

content:
7, 2014
												I've only played this a few hours so far, but I must recommend this to any fans of old school beat 'em up / hack and slash games.  While I haven't seen it bring anything particulary new to the table in my play thus far.  It does deliver a very solid performance for the genre.  Already in my play I have seen little nods to classics like Golden Axe and Battletoads that made me smile.  The art work is colorful and crisp and really pops.  The enemies vary as you go along to mix things up a little bit.  It is also rife with cheezy little humourous moments that will make you chuckle.One other neat thing is that you can find different weapons and pets throughout your play.  So you are not just stuck with the same stuff the whole time.  Also, as you play you level up your character and gain new combos along the way.  So there is some progression to the game play.I really can't find anything negative to say about it thus far, except for maybe the fact that if you want to change pets/weapon you have to go back to your home castle and it can take a moment to navigate the map back to where you were, but it is a minor inconvieniance at most.I picked this game up for DIRT CHEAP during the Summer Sale and it is absolutely worth every penny.  Best beat 'em up I've played on PC since Little Fighter.

content:
, 2014
												Even though so far, I have only played this game for 2.5 hours on the PC ... I own it on my Xbox 360 thus have played over 60 hours on there.Regarding the game itself regardless of platform ... it's an awesome game. The jokes are well timed, the combat is pretty addicting since it's all fast paced, the co-op for this game works wonderfully well, and the fact you can get creative in how you kill your enemies. For example, you can equip any dropped weapon if your states meets it's requirements. Or perhaps you want to just use a bow the entire way. That's fine too! Though if you use a bow, better upgrade that agility up lol.Interesting enough, you can have 'pets' with you. I think pets really makes this game stand out more since each animal has a different ability. The owl will bring you food, the bat will bite enemie's heads off, the golden whale shall crap out golden blocks. It's all really cool to see plus the artistic design is appealing to how the game's mechanics work out.On the PC, it's not only as glorious as the Xbox 360 version... you don't even need a controller. Unlike most action games where a controller is required, the game allows you to set up the controls on your keyboard. Any action + item use + movement can all be changed. Thanks to this, playing on the keyboard is actually possible thus I can play without any troubles. It's a huge relief to be honest since games like Double Dragon Neon is truly hard without connecting a controller. This game is amazing and just great to play with your friends. I advise you see for yourself.

content:
, 2014
												Castle Crashers is a cartoon-style adventure game where four knights go on a quest to stop an evil wizard and return the four princesses. Along the way the knights will face an army of barbarians, travel through a forest infested with theives, crash a wedding, fight off a giant troll from the back of a high-speed carriage, fight a dragon who loves sock puppets, get abducted by aliens, play volleyball on a sand castle roof, fight Medusa on a bad hair day, defeat a necromancer, and save the four princesses. All things considered, it's definitely a great game.

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
er 29, 2016
nukes-viewHi all, nukes here.Castle Crashers is a 2D side scrolling hack and slash adventure. Easy to pick up and play, I enjoyed playing this game solo and online with friends (up to 4 players).This game is very well put together and the developers have a knack for 2D side scrolling games. Great humour and art styles with a variety of musical artists creating great music for each level.The Game PlaySimple side scrolling game (works best with a controller)with great combo's and intuitive magic system. Simple levelling system and many different characters you can unlock, items you can find and pets you can make love you.DifficultyThe difficulty is pretty straight forward but not restricting there is a harder difficulty that you can unlock after completion, which can be found on the map after the first boss. Can only be done with same character.Controls & InterfaceGeared towards playing with a controller but not limited, as keyboard can work just as well.I just found it much easier with controller.AchievementsThis game has simple and fun achievements that are relatively easy to get and nothing that you would lose sleep over.StoryYou play a knight out to save the princess's and to defeat a dark evil wizard, on your journey you will encounter many hardships. Be brave young knight.Combat System The combat system is simple and fun revolving around a hack slash method with great combos that are given to you along your journey through levelling up.Magic spells are also learnt in the same way which can sway the battle in your favour.Pet companions can also be found throughout, used to give your character unique perks or advantages in battle that can help on your quest.Got to love RammyLevelingSimple levelling system that lets you place points into four attributes that increase your characters stats.The magic spells, can be quite different per character and all have great uses. Try out different characters to find the spells that suit you. Sounds & EffectsThe music for this game was composed by a variety of different artists and I found some of the music to be great and even downloaded a few of them myself from NewGrounds[www.newgrounds.com]for freeFavourite has to be this one but it isn't listed in the list.GraphicsThe graphics are simplistic but I found them very pleasing and suiting to the game. Cut ScenesI found the cut scenes well thought-out and funny, got to love the ending of the cyclops.Humour & TriviaI loved the humour of this game it is brilliant and suited for all ages and retains the same style throughout.MultiplayerThis game has a fantastic multiplayer that lets you play co operatively with friends either locally or online. Castle Crashers offers a small range of fun multiplayer modes where you can go up against friends in a fighting, feeding frenzy and good old volley ball real man's game.Bugs - ImportantNo bugs or issues were found.ConclusionI loved Castle Crashers and would happily go back to it if my friends asked, overall fun and great entertainment for all ages.Great to play with guests or friends at home.Easy to pick up and play and then just walk away if needed.I would say the only downside to this game is, that lately the online community has dwindled, best to play with friends.I will be keeping a close eye on the developers to see if they have any future releases planned as I really do like their style of games.Hope I helped.ηυĸєΜ266

content:
ry 15, 2015
THIS REVIEW IS ABOUT CONTENT FROM BEFORE THE REMASTERED PATCH!Do I reccomend Castle Crashers? Yes.Do I reccomend you buy the title on Steam? No.Castle Crashers is an Arcade-Style Side-Scrolling Beat 'Em Up with a level-up system, unique playable characters and loads of weapons!Where this game succeeds is in its focus around cooperative play, but can still be played to its completion alone. Behemoth's "Game 2" has brought fun times to players for almost 7 years now.So what are the good qualities of this game?
1-4 player cooperative story mode sure to pack laughter and anger in one box2-4 player pvp arena modeAmazing soundtrack that will make you want to play levels over just to hear themBehemoth's signature cartoony yet brutal gameplayACTION! COMEDY! ROMANCE!Over 80 weapons to tweak your stats outside of the level-up systemNow, this game is great and a must have, just not on Steam.
If you don't have one or more friend(s) who are willing to play this whenever you are, this game will get really old really fastTerrible, and I mean TERRIBLE online multiplayer. Whether you're playing with somebody across the country or across the room, 95 times out of 100 there will be unbearable periods of lag on one or more players' ends, causing all players to see different screens. Some examples may be that a player is standing still, using their W key attack, while another player is seeing them using their W key reviving another player. On one screen you may see your teammate dead on the ground, while they are actually fighting something you may not even see!Button prompts are displayed as X-Box buttons. Leaving players who didn't read and memorize the chart on the main menu often clueless on what to pressIf you're not playing together on the same machine, don't play together at allSo all in all, I do reccomend Castle Crashers to players. I myself picked this up for 70 cents on the last Steam Summer Sale, having no idea of the lagfest I was getting myself into. Only buy this on Steam if you plan to play by yourself a lot.I suggest you pick up this title up on another platform. Either the X-Box Live Arcade or the PlayStation Store.

content:
ry 10, 2014
												The game is fun - especially with friends! So don't think I don't like this game. It's got a hefty amount of clever jokes that aren't too far shoved in your face (like I noticed Ceiling Cat watching me from above in the pet store). But the controls for this game are... to put it gently... relatively poor.It recommends an Xbox controller, but it's a PC game so it should assume the majority of people will play it using a mouse and keyboard. It translates it's controls as though you're using an Xbox controller first off - something that was a really bad sign to me at first - but the real thing that crimps the controls is the fact you have to hold some buttons and tap others to activate this or that action. Your starting spell for instance is simply "Hold Shift, press Strong-Attack" while the bolt version of it would be "Hold Shift, Press Use-Item". Even then to cast spells in the air you have to use different buttons (Strong-Attack or Use-Item) to decide if you shoot horizontally or downwards which is just feels off (why not just let the movement keys press the direction you want to aim?). The fact that you can't even seperate the Item, magic, and the melee commands makes it bug♥♥♥♥ disorienting. It's a keyboard: It has enough buttons to cover the actions without having to resort to playing Twister with your fingers.That said I can't say I've played it and not had a blast yet. Granted I've only been playing it a couple of days so far. It's by no means an easy game, but it's a fun one.

content:
y 31, 2014
												Great fun game for the whole family, or just good 4 player sidecroller to mash enemies with your friends. TONS of unlockable characters, and a relatively easy achievement list to 100% if you are an achievement hunter. The DLC packs are cheap and totally great adding two extra Characters, The Blacksmith and The Pink Knight.Insanity mode after game completion offers a new difficulty to play through increasing the amount of playability and extending the level grinding to a more enjoyable and challenging setting. The artwork is great as well. It is very colorful and family friendly. The Game is playable by all ages (with a few poop and fart jokes in the mix).I also like that with my Xbox 360 Wireless Receiver for Windows I am able to hook up more than one controller and allow more than 1 player/controller to be supported by a single USB port and play/level multiple characters at once as my friends can choose my other characters and level along with me.Also available on the Playstation Network and Xbox Market. I would certainly recommend this game to anyone and everyone. Loads of enjoyment, replayability, and good laughs.10/10

content:
r 7, 2013
												An extremely fun side scrolling, beat'em up, co-op rpg.  While it is nothing that  we haven't all seen before,  Castle Crashers executes all aspects of this  type of game perfectly.   Each character, do to color coordination, is easily identifiable.  Unique special abilities help each player  stand apart, as well as weapon choices, secondary items and companions that add passive abilities and stats.There is an rpg aspect that allows each player to upgrade his or her character's stats separately from the rest.  The enemies are well balanced as well as each type possessing its own attacks and abilities.  Almost every level has a boss at the end.Similar to Diablo, you can play back through after completion for a greater challenge.  I recommend having 4 players when you do this; otherwise, the game might begin to feel off balance.The game as a whole offers solid game play, good re-playability, fun co-op and many laughs.  A good buy if you plan on playing with a group of friends.Note: there  is a bit of lag when using the keyboard; the game is built around the game pad.


Castle Crashers 
A Screenshot of Castle Crashers
By: Vash(88)

												Loved that they made this game available for PC play. The default key bindings are wonky and I feel they were poorly chosen for someone without a controller. This game really isn't difficult without a controller, I'm not sure why they are pushing for one so hard. An easy recustomization of your key bindings isn't too hard. Fun overall old gem of a game. It was great for the era it came out in and is still fun to replay to this day.
